about: b'Thought to be companions to the ancient Vikings, the Icelandic Sheepdog breed was used to protect flocks, especially lambs, from birds of prey. They still retain the habit of watching the sky and barking at birds \xe2\x80\x94 as well as everything else they see or hear.This breed is also known as\xc2\xa0the Icelandic Spitz or Icelandic Dog. Even though these are purebred dogs, you may find them in the care of shelters or rescue groups. Remember to\xc2\xa0adopt! Don\xe2\x80\x99t shop if you want to bring a dog home.Icelandic Sheepdogs are very affectionate with their humans, and as you may have guessed, they do well in colder climates. However, novice pet parents should beware. These dogs have high energy and won\xe2\x80\x99t take as well to apartment life. If you can provide plenty of exercise and open space, along with experienced and consistent training, then this might be the dog for you!See below for complete list of dog breed traits and facts about Icelandic Sheepdogs!Icelandic Sheepdog Breed Pictures Icelandic Sheepdog Dog Breed Information, Pictures, Characteristics & Facts - DogtimeInitiate Gallery'

b'The Irish Red and White Setter dog breed barely escaped extinction when most breeders began focusing on the all-red varieties. Now they\xe2\x80\x99re considered a separate breed from their Irish Setter cousins.Even though these are purebred dogs, you may find them in the care of shelters or rescue groups. Remember to\xc2\xa0adopt! Don\xe2\x80\x99t shop if you want to bring a dog home.As gundogs, the Irish Red and White Setters are slow to train but eventually become loyal and reliable hunters. They can also be great family companions, though their high energy and exercise needs make them a poor choice for apartment dwellers or those who can\xe2\x80\x99t keep up with them physically. If you can provide them with plenty of activity for their body and brain, this may be the breed for you!See below for complete list of dog breed traits and facts about Irish Red and White Setters!Irish Red And White Setter Dog Breed Pictures Irish Red and White Setter Dog Breed Information, Pictures, Characteristics & Facts \xe2\x80\x93 DogTimeInitiate Gallery'
height: 22 to 26 inches tall at the shoulder'

about: b'Irish Setters originated as a\xc2\xa0gundogs\xc2\xa0in their native Ireland, and the dog breed\xe2\x80\x98s popularity soon spread, thanks to the beauty of their rich mahogany coat and their enthusiasm as bird dogs.They\xe2\x80\x99re friendly, mischievous, and inquisitive, with high energy levels. This is a bold and boisterous family friend with the potential to do well in many canine sports and activities.DogTime recommends this dog bed to give a good night\xe2\x80\x99s sleep to your medium-sized Irish Setter.\xc2\xa0You should also pick up this dog brush and massager for your long-haired pup!See all dog breed traits and facts about Irish Setters below!Irish Setter Dog Breed Pictures Irish Setter Dog Breed Information, Pictures, Characteristics & Facts - DogtimeInitiate Gallery'
height: 2 feet, 1 inch to 2 feet, 3 inches tall at the shoulder'

about: b'The Irish Terrier dog breed was once described as the \xe2\x80\x9cpoor man\xe2\x80\x99s sentinel, the farmer\xe2\x80\x99s friend, and the gentleman\xe2\x80\x99s favorite.\xe2\x80\x9d Rugged and stouthearted, they have the advantages of a convenient size, versatile abilities as a companion, watchdog, and vermin dispatcher, and high train-ability.Even though these are purebred dogs, some may still end up in the care of shelters or rescues. Consider adoption if this is the breed for you.Irish Terriers are super affectionate toward the humans in their lives, though they may prefer to be the solo pet in the home. Early socialization can help them warm up to other dogs and pets. This breed also has high energy and will need a good amount of exercise. Apartment dwellers and those who must leave home for long hours of the day may have a hard time meeting the Irish Terrier\xe2\x80\x99s physical needs. But if you can provide plenty of attention, patience, and space to move, you\xe2\x80\x99ll have a loving, lifelong companion.DogTime recommends this dog bed to give a good night\xe2\x80\x99s sleep to your medium-sized Irish Terrier.\xc2\xa0You should also pick up this dog de-shedder for your high shedding pup!See all Irish Terrier dog breed facts and characteristics below!Irish Terrier Dog Breed Pictures Irish Terrier Dog Breed Information, Pictures, Characteristics & Facts \xe2\x80\x93 DogtimeInitiate Gallery'
height: 18 to 20 inches tall at the shoulder'

about: b'Whether they\xe2\x80\x99re splashing after ducks or showing off in the agility ring, canines of the Irish Water Spaniel dog breed do everything with a sense of fun. Created in Ireland as a water retriever, they\xe2\x80\x99re rare these days but make excellent companions for active and experienced dog owners, especially if they live near a body of water.Although dogs of this breed have high intelligence and learn easily, they also have a stubborn side that can prove troublesome for novice dog parents. Make sure you can keep up with firm, consistent training before you decide that this is the breed for you.DogTime recommends this dog bed to give a good night\xe2\x80\x99s sleep to your medium-sized Irish Water Spaniel.\xc2\xa0You should also pick up this dog fetch toy to help burn off your pup\xe2\x80\x99s high energy!See all dog breed traits and facts about Irish Water Spaniels below!Irish Water Spaniel Dog Breed Pictures Irish Water Spaniel Dog Breed Information, Pictures, Characteristics & Facts - DogtimeInitiate Gallery'
height: 1 foot, 9 inches to 2 feet tall at the shoulder'

about: b'The Irish Wolfhound dog breed was originally used in war to drag men off horses and chariots. They also hunted large game such as deer, boar, and wolves. Today this adaptable dog is a family companion who also competes in obedience, tracking, and lure coursing.Even though these are purebred dogs, some may still end up in the care of shelters or rescues. Consider adoption if this is the breed for you.The Irish Wolfhound is, on average, the tallest dog breed in the world, although several other breeds can outweigh them. Because of this, apartment dwellers will have a lot of difficulty providing enough space for these dogs to move around and thrive. But for families with plenty of room to roam, Irish Wolfhounds make for extremely loving companions, even to children. Just make sure you have a fence\xe2\x80\x93and a tall one at that\xe2\x80\x93to prevent your dog from chasing wildlife.DogTime recommends this big, spacious crate to give your big Irish Wolfhound a place to rest and relax.\xc2\xa0You should also pick up this dog brush and massager for your long-haired pup!See all Irish Wolfhound dog breed facts and characteristics below!Irish Wolfhound Dog Breed Pictures Irish Wolfhound Dog Breed Information, Pictures, Characteristics & Facts - DogtimeInitiate Gallery'
height: 32 to 35 inches tall at the shoulder'

about: b'The Italian Greyhound dog breed was a favorite companion of noblewomen in the Middle Ages, especially in Italy. But this small hound was more than a lapdog, having the speed, endurance, and determination to hunt small game. These days, they\xe2\x80\x99re a family dog whose beauty and athleticism is admired in the show ring and in obedience, agility, and rally competitions.Although these are purebred dogs, you may still find them in shelters and rescues. Remember to adopt! Don\xe2\x80\x99t shop if you want to bring a dog home.Italian Greyhounds adapt well to apartment life, and they\xe2\x80\x99re loving companions to everyone in the home, including kids and other dogs. Even novice pet parents will fall in love with these easy-to-groom pups. However, they don\xe2\x80\x99t take well to being left alone at home for long hours during the day. They\xe2\x80\x99re highly sensitive and need companionship. Shower your pup with the love they deserve and toss in some vigorous play and exercise, and you\xe2\x80\x99ll have a devoted best furry friend!See below for complete list of dog breed traits and facts about Italian Greyhounds!Italian Greyhound Dog Breed Pictures Italian Greyhound Dog Breed Information, Pictures, Characteristics & Facts \xe2\x80\x93 DogTimeInitiate Gallery'
height: 13 to 15 inches tall at the shoulder'

about: b'The Jack-A-Poo is mixed breed dog\xe2\x80\x93a cross between the Jack Russell Terrier and Poodle dog breeds. Generally the Poodle parent is Miniature or Toy sized, as opposed to Standard. Affectionate, lively, and intelligent, Jack-A-Poos are energetic pups who make great family dogs.The Jack-A-Poo has many other names, including\xc2\xa0Jack-A-Doodle, Jackadoodle, Jackdoodle, Jackapoodle, Jack A Poo, Jackapoo, Jack-A-Poodle, Jackpoo, Poojack, and Poo-Jack.\xc2\xa0They are considered \xe2\x80\x9cdesigner dogs,\xe2\x80\x9d bred on purpose to emphasize desirable characteristics from each breed. As always, please adopt if you\xe2\x80\x99re looking to add one of these dogs to your life. You can find them at shelters and breed specific rescues. Remember, when you adopt, you save two lives: the one you bring home and the one you make room for at the rescue.These little balls of energy would be well-suited to apartment living due to their small-to-medium size, but only if the owner can take them out for plenty of exercise. Otherwise, they\xc2\xa0might prefer to live in a house that has space for running around. It\xe2\x80\x99s important to give your Jack-A-Poo plenty of attention and keep them stimulated, so their hardworking, clever nature can be used for good\xe2\x80\x93otherwise, they could become destructive and bark a lot. However, these behaviors can be nipped in the bud with early training. If you\xe2\x80\x99re ready for a high-energy friend who wants to be by your side as much as possible, this\xc2\xa0might be a great pup for you!DogTime recommends this carrier for traveling with your small Jack-A-Poo.\xc2\xa0You should also pick up this dog fetch toy to help burn off your pup\xe2\x80\x99s high energy!See below for all mixed dog breed traits and facts about Jack-A-Poos!Jack-A-Poo Mixed Dog Breed Pictures Jack-A-Poo Mixed Dog Breed Pictures, Characteristics, & FactsInitiate Gallery'

b'The Jack Chi is a mixed breed dog \xe2\x80\x94 a cross between the Jack Russell Terrier and Chihuahua dog breeds. Friendly, playful, and energetic, these pups inherited some of the best qualities from both of their parents.The Jack Chi is also sometimes called the Jackahuahua and the Jackhuahua. You may find these mixed breed dogs in shelters and rescues, so remember to always adopt! Don\xe2\x80\x99t shop if you\xe2\x80\x99re looking to add one of these pups to your home!These adorable mixed breed dogs make great low-maintenance companions. They\xe2\x80\x99re sweet and playful and always super fun to have around. Also, this mixed breed is totally fine living in apartment situations, and most are pretty quiet dogs without any yapping tendencies.See below for all mixed dog breed traits and facts about Jack Chis!Jack Chi Mixed Dog Breed Pictures Jack Chi Mixed Dog Breed Pictures, Characteristics, & FactsInitiate Gallery'

b'Developed in England some 200 years ago to hunt foxes, the Jack Russell Terrier, also known as the Parson Russell Terrier, is a lively, independent, and clever little dog. They\xe2\x80\x99re charming and affectionate, but they\xe2\x80\x99re also a handful to train and manage. For experienced dog parents only!Although these are purebred dogs, you may still find them in shelters and rescues. Remember to adopt! Don\xe2\x80\x99t shop if this is the breed for you.At first, this small, adorable, and affectionate dog may seem like a good choice for new pet parents and apartment dwellers. But you may find yourself surprised at this little pup\xe2\x80\x99s energy and intensity. These dogs need plenty of exercise and firm, consistent training, or else they may act out with unwanted behaviors. That said, if you know how to handle a bit of rowdiness and can keep up with an energetic pup, you\xe2\x80\x99ll be rewarded with a loving and loyal friend for life.DogTime recommends this carrier for traveling with your small Jack Russell Terrier.\xc2\xa0You should also pick up this dog fetch toy to help burn off your pup\xe2\x80\x99s high energy!See below for complete list of Jack Russell Terrier dog breed facts and characteristics!Jack Russell Terrier Dog Breed Pictures Jack Russell Terrier Dog Breed Information, Pictures, Characteristics & Facts \xe2\x80\x93 DogtimeInitiate Gallery'
height: 10 to 15 inches tall at the shoulder'

about: b'The Jackshund is a mixed breed dog\xe2\x80\x93a cross between the Jack Russell Terrier and Dachshund dog breeds. Affectionate, lively, and playful, these pups inherited some of the best traits from two very different parents. The mix of different personalities and appearances will make for a fun, attractive dog!Also known as a Jackweenie, the Jackshund is considered a \xe2\x80\x9cdesigner dog,\xe2\x80\x9d bred on purpose to emphasize desirable characteristics from each breed. As always, please adopt if you\xe2\x80\x99re looking to add one of these dogs to your life. You can find them at shelters and breed specific rescues. Adopt! Don\xe2\x80\x99t shop!Jackshunds are loving and energetic with a bit of a range on energy, so you should be prepared to offer this dog plenty of exercise and cuddling. Their small-to-medium size makes them well-suited to a multitude of different homes; with enough space, a good portion of their exercise could be done indoors. Their energy level, tendency to dig, Olympic-quality jumping, and dedicated scent-following makes a high-fenced yard a great idea.The easiest owner to match would be an active single person or couple, with plenty of time and energy to devote to their dog; however, with proper socialization and training, the Jackshund could be best friends with a whole family. Due to their hunting background, it would be best not to add small animals into the environment, such as birds, rodents, or even cats. If you must, be sure to supervise interactions or keep them separate. Jackshunds also have a stubborn streak, but early training will help with this, too. If you\xe2\x80\x99re looking for a silly, sweet, fun best friend, this may be the dog for you!DogTime recommends this carrier for traveling with your small Jackshund.\xc2\xa0You should also pick up this dog brush and massager for your short-haired pup!See below for all\xc2\xa0Jackshund facts and mixed dog breed characteristics!Jackshund Mixed Dog Breed Pictures Jackshund Mixed Dog Breed Pictures, Characteristics, & FactsInitiate Gallery \xc2\xa0'

b'The Japanese Chin dog breed hails from Asia, where they\xe2\x80\x99ve been prized as a companion for more than a thousand years. They were a popular member of Chinese and Japanese imperial courts, and it was in Japan that their distinctive look was developed.Although these are purebred dogs, you may still find them in shelters and rescues. Remember to adopt! Don\xe2\x80\x99t shop if you want to bring a dog home.This breed is elegant and dainty, mild-mannered and playful. They adapt well to apartment life and even take to novice pet parents with ease; although, they don\xe2\x80\x99t much care for being left alone at home for long hours. These dogs also have a habit of climbing, and you may be surprised when you find your pooch atop the most unusual high places in the home, surveying their domain. Give your Chin plenty of attention and love, and you\xe2\x80\x99ll have an easygoing, adoring cuddle buddy.See below for complete list of dog breed traits and facts about Japanese Chins!Japanese Chin Dog Breed Pictures Japanese Chin Dog Breed Information, Pictures, Characteristics & Facts \xe2\x80\x93 DogTimeInitiate Gallery'
height: 8 to 11 inches tall at the shoulder'

about: b'The Japanese Spitz is a small family companion with the heart of a large watchdog. This breed may look similar to American Eskimo Dogs, white Pomeranians, or small Samoyeds, but Japanese Spitzes have their own lineages and hail from, as you might guess, Japan. Although the American Kennel Club does not recognize this breed, many other kennel clubs around the world accept them.Japanese Spitz dogs are also intelligent, easy to train, low-maintenance, and great with children. They make good apartment dogs, so long as pet parents meet their exercise needs, and they have fairly low grooming needs, despite the appearance of their gorgeous, white fur.Dogs of this breed are protective of their human families, even though they\xe2\x80\x99re small in stature, and they\xe2\x80\x99re known to bark when strangers enter their territory without backing down. If you want a dog who will be a dedicated family member with spirit and personality that far exceed their physical size, the Japanese Spitz might be the pooch for you.Also, see below for complete list of dog breed traits and facts!Japanese Spitz Dog Breed Pictures Japanese Spitz Dog Breed Information & Pictures \xe2\x80\x93 DogtimeInitiate Gallery'

b'Originating in South Korea, the Korean Jindo Dog exhibits unmatched loyalty. They are also incredibly intelligent dogs with a knack for hunting, tricks, and even agility. Fastidious and quiet indoors, they make great household pets and companions.Jindos require strong training, patience, and plenty of long walks. However, this makes them a good fit for active individuals and families who have enough time to let their wonderful personalities shine through. If you want a faithful friend who will learn quickly and love every member of your household, then the Korean Jindo Dog may be right for you.Also, see below for a complete list of dog breed traits and facts about Korean Jindo Dogs!Korean Jindo Dog Breed Pictures Korean Jindo Dog Breed Information & Pictures \xe2\x80\x93 DogtimeInitiate Gallery'
height: 19\xc2\xbd to 21 inches for males and 18\xc2\xbd to 20 inches for females'

about: b'The Kai Ken was discovered in the mountains of Kai, right near Mt. Fuji.\xc2\xa0Believed to be one of the purest and most ancient dog breeds of Japan, this rare dog is a skilled hunter and highly intelligent. Today, advocates of the breed work tirelessly to build up the dogs\xe2\x80\x99 small population, especially in the United States and Japan.In their native land, Kai Ken are sometimes referred to as Kai Uni or Tora Inu. They\xe2\x80\x99ve also earned the nickname of Tiger Dog, thanks to their signature striped, brindle coats. Although these are rather rare purebreds, you may still find them at local shelters and rescue groups. Remember to adopt! Don\xe2\x80\x99t shop if this is the breed for you.Dogs of this breed are incredibly loyal and affectionate, which makes them a great choice for both families and single-dwellers. This ancient breed does have high energy levels though, and could turn to bored, destructive behavior if forced to lead a more sedentary lifestyle. They can also be a bit stubborn, which doesn\xe2\x80\x99t make them an ideal choice for novice pet parents. If you want a companion for your active life and have experience with dog ownership, then this might be the right breed for you.See below for complete list of Kai Ken dog breed facts and traits!Kai Ken Dog Breed Pictures Kai Ken Dog Breed Pictures, Characteristics, & FactsInitiate Gallery'

b'The Karelian Bear Dog, called Karjalankarhukoira in the breed\xe2\x80\x99s native Finland, is a strong, alert, and fearless breed that is capable of hunting or treeing small-to-large game \xe2\x80\x94 even aggressive game such as bears, lynxes, wild boars, wolves, and moose. It makes the list of the ten most common dog breeds in Finland, where people consider them a national treasure.Karelian Bear Dogs were bred to be naturally aggressive to other animals for hunting. For that reason, it takes a good deal of socialization and training to keep them as household pets. Also, they have high energy and exercise needs.However,\xc2\xa0Karelian Bear Dogs, are extremely loyal to their human families and are very protective watchdogs. So, for an owner willing to put in the work, socialize, train diligently, and give plenty of open space and physical activity, the Karelian Bear Dog can be a calm, loving family member.See below for complete list of all dog breed traits and facts about Karelian Bear Dogs!Karelian Bear Dog Breed Pictures Karelian Bear Dog Breed Information & Pictures \xe2\x80\x93 DogTimeInitiate Gallery'

b'The Keeshond is an old dog breed, once a companion and watchdog on the barges and boats that traveled the canals and rivers of Holland in the 17th and 18th centuries. He\xe2\x80\x99s almost exclusively a companion dog today.Even though these are purebred dogs, you may find them in the care of shelters or rescue groups. Remember to\xc2\xa0adopt! Don\xe2\x80\x99t shop if you want to bring a dog home.Keeshonds are people-lovers; willing to participate in all family activities, they thrive with people who expect this of their dog. They\xe2\x80\x99re lively, alert, and intelligent \xe2\x80\x94 qualities that won them status as the most beloved dog in Holland. These adaptable pups can even make good apartment pets, but beware that they have a tendency to bark \xe2\x80\x94 something neighbors might not appreciate. They also won\xe2\x80\x99t enjoy being left home alone for long hours of the day. If you can meet the breed\xe2\x80\x99s needs, you\xe2\x80\x99ll have a loving, fluffy family member.See below for complete list of dog breed traits and facts about Keeshonds!Keeshond Dog Breed Pictures Keeshond Dog Breed Information, Pictures, Characteristics & Facts \xe2\x80\x93 DogTimeInitiate Gallery'
height: 1 foot, 4 inches to 1 foot, 7 inches tall at the shoulder'

about: b'The Kerry Blue Terrier is the quintessential working dog. They hail from County Kerry, Ireland, where they were bred to hunt small game and birds, kill rodents, and herd sheep and cattle. Intelligent and brave, they became a cherished pet as well, displaying fierce devotion to their family or pack.Even though these are purebred dogs, some may still end up in the care of shelters or rescues. Consider adoption if this is the breed for you.While not a particularly well-known dog breed, the Kerry Blue enjoys a dedicated following of fanciers, thanks to their working abilities and loyal companionship. They\xe2\x80\x99re also quite friendly to just about all people, and they learn quickly despite being a bit strong willed from time to time. They do not, however, take quickly to other dogs and may prefer to be the solo pet in the home. Still, with patient training and plenty of exercise, these pups can make for loving and devoted members of the family.DogTime recommends this dog bed to give a good night\xe2\x80\x99s sleep to your medium-sized Kerry Blue Terrier.\xc2\xa0You should also pick up this dog fetch toy to help burn off your pup\xe2\x80\x99s high energy!See all Kerry Blue Terrier dog breed facts and characteristics below!Kerry Blue Terrier Dog Breed Pictures Kerry Blue Terrier Dog Breed Information, Pictures, Characteristics & Facts \xe2\x80\x93 DogtimeInitiate Gallery'
height: 17 to 19 inches tall at the shoulder'

about: b'The King Shepherd is a hard working, loyal companion dog. Confident and strong, their huge size would be a pretty big deterrent for any would-be predator. King Shepherds are protective of their families, but they\xe2\x80\x99re not aggressive dogs.The King Shepherd is a combination of several possible breeds but must include the\xc2\xa0German Shepherd. Most often, they are blended with the\xc2\xa0Alaskan Malamute and/or Great Pyrenees, and some older lines trace back to the Akita. Even though they might have an intimidating size, they\xe2\x80\x99re affectionate and loving.King Shepherds are versatile. This highly intelligent dog can do a variety of jobs from sheep herding to child companion, police dog, rescue work, or guide dog. They get along great with other dogs, but early socialization is an important factor for raising a friendly sociable pup.They can live in an apartment as long as they get plenty of exercise and room to stretch their legs. These dogs can get pretty large, so while they can live in an apartment, a house with a big yard might be a more ideal setting.DogTime recommends this big, spacious crate to give your big King Shepherd a place to rest and relax.\xc2\xa0You should also pick up this dog water bottle for any outdoor adventures you have with your pup!See below for complete list of King Shepherd hybrid dog breed facts and traits!King Shepherd Hybrid Dog Breed Picture (Picture Credit: posted with permission from _king_rhett on Instagram)'

b'Almost exclusive to Japan, the Kishu Ken is an ancient dog breed once used for hunting large game like boar. Some are still used as hunting dogs, but for the most part, the modern day Kishu Ken is a family dog in Japan, and they\xe2\x80\x99ve started to grow in popularity in the United States, as well.Some fans of the breed affectionately call them Kishu or Kishu Inu. Although\xc2\xa0these are purebred dogs, you may still find them in shelters and rescues. Remember to adopt! Don\xe2\x80\x99t shop if this is the breed for you.Dogs of this breed may not be the best choice for novice pet parents, as this headstrong hunter needs a gentle-but-firm hand along with consistent training. This ancient Japanese breed does well with both single dwellers and families; although, they tend to get attached to one person in the household. Although they\xe2\x80\x99re reserved in nature, they\xe2\x80\x99re quick to protect their humans. If you\xe2\x80\x99re looking for a calm companion who\xe2\x80\x99ll also alert you of potential danger, then this might be the breed for you.See below for complete list of Kishu Ken dog breed facts and traits!Kishu Ken Dog Breed Pictures Kishu Ken Dog Breed Pictures, Characteristics, & FactsInitiate Gallery'

b'Although the Komondor\xe2\x80\x99s appearance might make you think they were developed to mop floors, this pooch has a long and noble heritage as a flock-guarding dog breed in their native Hungary. They still retain a strong protective instinct and will defend their family and property with their life.In Hungarian, the plural form of Komondor is Komondorok. Although this is a purebred dog, you may be able to find them in shelters and rescues. So remember to adopt! Don\xe2\x80\x99t shop!Affectionate with their families, these dogs are intelligent and eager to please. Because they\xe2\x80\x99re so protective, they can make decent watchdogs and will bark if anything is amiss. They aren\xe2\x80\x99t, however, well-suited for apartment life and prefer to have lots of room to run and burn off energy. For a larger home in need of a loving guardian, this may be the dog for the job.DogTime recommends this big, spacious crate to give big Komondorok a place to rest and relax.\xc2\xa0You should also pick up this dog water bottle for any outdoor adventures you have with your pup!See all Komondor dog breed characteristics below!Komondor Dog Breed Pictures Komondor Dog Breed Information, Pictures, Characteristics & Facts - DogtimeInitiate Gallery'
height: 25 to 27 inches tall at the shoulder'

about: b'The good-natured Kooikerhondje hunting dog breed makes an affectionate family companion. Suspected to be an ancestor of the Nova Scota Duck Tolling Retriever, they hail from Holland and were used to lure ducks into traps for hunting or tagging. They still serve as hunting dogs, but also excel at other dog sports such as flyball.Although these are purebred dogs, you may find them in the care of shelters or rescues. Remember to adopt! Don\xe2\x80\x99t shop if you want to bring a dog home.Kooikerhondjes have plenty of energy, so they\xe2\x80\x99ll need lots of exercise. Make sure your pooch gets enough daily walks, and consider training them for dog sports competitons \xe2\x80\x94 or just for fun. Couch potatoes beware! about: b'The Kuvasz is a large, white, flock-guarding dog who hails from Hungary. A one-family dog, they\xe2\x80\x99re protective of their people and suspicious of strangers. Don\xe2\x80\x99t shop if you want to bring one of these pups home.Kuvaszok are big and protective, but they also have a sensitive side. They don\xe2\x80\x99t like to be away from family for long, so they won\xe2\x80\x99t do well with an owner who leaves them in an empty home for long hours of the day. They\xe2\x80\x99re also not a great fit for apartment dwellers, and they require an experienced owner who can give them plenty of space to run. However, if you\xe2\x80\x99ve got a big home and are up for the challenge, this pup will make an excellent guard dog, a smart exercise companion, and a loyal best friend for life!DogTime recommends this big, spacious crate to give your big Kuvasz a place to rest and relax.\xc2\xa0You should also pick up this dog water bottle for any outdoor adventures you have with your pup!See all Kuvasz Dog breed characteristics below!Kuvasz Dog Breed Pictures Kuvasz Dog Breed Information, Pictures, Characteristics & Facts - DogtimeInitiate Gallery'

b'The Lab Pointer is a mixed breed dog \xe2\x80\x94 a cross between the Labrador Retriever and Pointer dog breeds. b'It\xe2\x80\x99s not surprising that the Labradoodle has gained such popularity so quickly. Originally developed to be hypoallergenic guide dogs, the first planned crosses of Poodles and Labrador Retrievers were arranged by the Royal Guide Dogs Association of Australia.The result was a smart and sociable dog who not only possessed a nature appropriate for guide dogs but also had a low-shedding coat. While the hybrid is not yet achieving consistent results in coat or temperament, they\xe2\x80\x99re wildly popular and affectionate dogs.Some of these hybrid dogs end up in shelters or rescues. If you want to bring one of these loving, faithful, and adorable dogs into your home, then make sure you opt to adopt if you can!DogTime recommends this big, spacious crate to give your big Labradoodle a place to rest and relax.\xc2\xa0You should also pick up this dog water bottle for any outdoor adventures you have with your pup!See below for all hybrid dog breed traits and facts about Labradoodles!Labradoodle Hybrid Dog Breed Pictures Labradoodle Mixed Dog Breed Pictures, Characteristics, & FactsInitiate Gallery'

b'The Labrador Retriever was bred to be both a friendly companion and a useful working dog breed. Historically, they earned their keep as fishermen\xe2\x80\x99s helpers: hauling nets, fetching ropes, and retrieving fish from the chilly North Atlantic.Today\xe2\x80\x99s Lab is as good-natured and hardworking as their ancestors, and they\xe2\x80\x99re also America\xe2\x80\x99s most popular breed. Modern Labs work as retrievers for hunters, assistance dogs, show competitors, and search and rescue dogs, among other canine jobs.DogTime recommends this dog bed to give a good night\xe2\x80\x99s sleep to your medium-sized Lab.\xc2\xa0You should also pick up this dog de-shedder for your high shedding pup!See below for all Labrador Retriever facts and dog breed traits!Labrador Retriever Dog Breed Pictures Labrador Retriever Dog Breed Information, Pictures, Characteristics & Facts - DogtimeInitiate Gallery'

They\xe2\x80\x99re loyal to their family and will strike up strong bonds with the kids in a household. True to the dog\xe2\x80\x99s social nature, they don\xe2\x80\x99t enjoy being alone for long periods of time and may get into mischief if you leave them alone at home or in a yard. b'The Labsky is a mixed breed dog \xe2\x80\x94 a cross between the Labrador Retriever and Siberian Husky dog breeds. Active, smart, and loyal, these pups inherited some of the best qualities from both of their parents.Labskies also go by the name Huskador. b'Lagotto Romagnolo means \xe2\x80\x9clake dog from Romagna,\xe2\x80\x9d which is a good name for this breed, considering these dogs originally helped hunt waterfowl through the wet marshlands of Romagna in Italy.They\xe2\x80\x99re also known as Italian Water Dogs and Romagna Water Dogs. Today, with many of the marshlands of the breed\xe2\x80\x99s homeland drained, these dogs have found a new purpose in truffle hunting. Humans can easily train them to use their super noses for scent work. Lagottos\xe2\x80\x99 thick coats help them stay warm in fall and winter while protecting them from thorns and debris as they run through forests.They\xe2\x80\x99re the only dogs bred for the specific purpose of truffle hunting in modern times. Their keen sense of smell and natural tendency to dig make them experts at the task. Lagotto Romagnolos can also make loving, active, easygoing household pets with few demands. Their hypoallergenic coats are good for allergy sufferers, though those coats require a good deal of maintenance. So, if you can keep up with grooming and brushing and you want a dedicated, easily-trained companion \xe2\x80\x94 or someone to help you hunt for delicious truffles \xe2\x80\x94 then this dog may fit right in with your family.Also, see below for complete list of dog breed traits and facts about Lagotto Romagnolos!Lagotto Romagnolo Dog Breed Pictures Lagotto Romagnolo Dog Breed Information & Pictures \xe2\x80\x93 DogtimeInitiate Gallery'

b'Lakeland Terriers were originally bred to hunt the foxes that preyed on sheep during the lambing season in Northern England\xe2\x80\x99s Lake District. Today\xe2\x80\x99s Lakies, as these lively, feisty little dogs are nicknamed, are affectionate, friendly, and self-confident.Even though these are purebred dogs, some may still end up in the care of shelters or rescues. Consider adoption if this is the breed for you.The Lakeland Terrier is an affectionate dog when it comes to the humans in their life. Even though they have high energy and exercise needs, their small size can help them adapt to apartment living, so long as they get plenty of physical activity. For a home with a backyard, a high, sturdy fence is a must to prevent roaming and wildlife chasing. These dogs respond well to confident pet parents who can set boundaries. Give this pup lots of patient training and active playtime, and you\xe2\x80\x99ll have a loving, furry family member.DogTime recommends this dog bed to give a good night\xe2\x80\x99s sleep to your medium-sized Lakie. about: b'The lively, spirited\xc2\xa0Manchester Terrier\xc2\xa0dog breed is a true terrier. Bred in Manchester, England for ratting and rabbit coursing, this dog has game and they love to show it. The Gentleman\xe2\x80\x99s Terrier (as they\xe2\x80\x99re known in Victorian England) is not a sparring dog but loves a good chase. This makes them a flyball and agility rock star.Even though these are purebred dogs, you may find them in the care of shelters or rescue groups. Remember to\xc2\xa0adopt! Don\xe2\x80\x99t shop if you want to bring a dog home.Though their looks may remind you of a miniature Doberman Pinscher or a large Miniature Pinscher, the Manchester Terrier is their own canine. A wee dog with a strong bark, they\xe2\x80\x99ve got personality to burn: loyal, hearty, and a terrific watchdog who adores hanging out with their people. Among terriers, the Manchester is known to be one of the more well-mannered and responsive breeds and today spends their time as a terrific companion who can hold up their end of the conversation.See below for complete dog breed traits and facts about Manchester Terriers!Manchester Terrier Dog Breed Pictures Manchester Terrier Dog Breed Information, Pictures, Characteristics & Facts - DogTimeInitiate Gallery'

about: b'The Miniature Pinscher dog breed was originally bred in Germany to hunt vermin, primarily rats, in homes and stables. However, the Min Pin is a distinct and much older breed.Even though these are purebred dogs, you may find them in the care of shelters or rescue groups. Remember to\xc2\xa0adopt! They can adapt to apartment life, but due to their high energy, they need plenty of exercise. If you can meet the breed\xe2\x80\x99s needs, you\xe2\x80\x99ll have a loving little family members who will keep you active and on your toes!See below for complete list of dog breed traits and facts about Minature Pinschers!Minature Pinscher Dog Breed Pictures Miniature Pinscher Dog Breed Information, Pictures, Characteristics & Facts \xe2\x80\x93 DogTimeInitiate Gallery'

about: b'The\xc2\xa0Miniature Schnauzer\xc2\xa0dog breed has it all in one small package: intelligence, affection, an extroverted temperament, humor, and a personality that\xe2\x80\x99s twice as big as their bodies. Throw in that walrus mustache and quivering enthusiasm, and they\xe2\x80\x99ll make you laugh every day.Although these are purebred dogs, you may still find them in shelters and rescues. Remember to adopt! Don\xe2\x80\x99t shop if this is the breed for you.With a Miniature Schnauzer in the house, you\xe2\x80\x99ll never be alone, not even when you go to the bathroom. They\xe2\x80\x99ve got personality-plus, and whether they\xe2\x80\x99re bounding around ahead of you or curled up snoozing on your lap, you\xe2\x80\x99ll never be bored with one of these pups around. Just make sure you can give them plenty of exercise to keep up with their high energy!DogTime recommends this carrier for traveling with your small Schnauzer buddy.\xc2\xa0You should also pick up this dog fetch toy to help burn off your pup\xe2\x80\x99s high energy!See all Miniature Schnauzer dog breed facts and characteristics below!Miniature Schnauzer Dog Breed Pictures Miniature Schnauzer Dog Breed Information, Pictures, Characteristics & Facts \xe2\x80\x93 DogtimeInitiate Gallery'
height: 13 to 14 inches tall at the shoulder'

about: b'The Morkie is a mixed breed dog\xe2\x80\x93a cross between the Maltese and the Yorkshire Terrier dog breeds. Small, energetic, and super silly, these pups inherited some of the best qualities from both their parents.This crossbreed is usually referred to as the Morkie, but it is sometimes called the Morkshire Terrier. Despite their unfortunate status as a designer breed, you can find these mixed-breed dogs at shelters and breed-specific rescues. Remember, when you are looking for pets, adopt! Don\xe2\x80\x99t shop!These adorable dogs make excellent apartment pets for urban dwellers, and they tend to thrive in small or single-person households. Morkies can also be on the yappier side, like their parents. If you want an energetic, loving pup who will always want your attention, this might be the right dog for you.See below for all mixed dog breed traits and facts about Morkies!Morkie Mixed Dog Breed Pictures Morkie Mixed Dog Breed Pictures, Characteristics, & FactsInitiate Gallery'

b'Alert, active, and smart, the Mudi (pronounced \xe2\x80\x9cmoody\xe2\x80\x9d) is a highly trainable herding dog who can perform almost any task well. That includes watchdog duties, hunting, agility and obedience competitions, search and rescue, and more.Also known as the Hungarian Mudi, this breed originated in Hungary. They helped shepherds maintain their flocks, and were often called \xe2\x80\x9cdriver dog.\xe2\x80\x9d Even today, they\xe2\x80\x99re used in Hungary for their herding skills and can help shepherds with flocks of up to 500 sheep.Mudis have high exercise needs; however, they can also be calm family members when properly stimulated, both physically and mentally. Train them with positive reinforcement and don\xe2\x80\x99t rely on punishment or harsh rebukes. If you train them well, you\xe2\x80\x99ll have a loyal, smart, loving dog who\xe2\x80\x99ll protect and adore you for life.See below for complete list of dog breed traits and facts about Mudis!Mudi Dog Breed Pictures Mudi Dog Breed Information & Pictures \xe2\x80\x93 DogtimeInitiate Gallery'

b'A Mutt or mixed\xc2\xa0breed dog is a testament to nature. Without any input \xe2\x80\x94 some might say interference\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\x94\xc2\xa0from humans, the mixed breed defies description. Available in all sizes, shapes, colors, and patterns, they might have a long snout or a short nose. They may display pointed ears or floppy ones. They could have a stubby tail, spindly legs, a giant spot over their left eye\xc2\xa0\xe2\x80\x94\xc2\xa0or all three.The combinations of parent breeds are as endless as the possibilities for mixed breed dogs. Luckily, you can find plenty of these pups in the care of shelters and rescues. Adopt! Don\xe2\x80\x99t shop!And as the ultimate family dog, the mixed breed excels where the purebred lacks. Drawing from a broader, more diverse gene pool, their intensity is softer than their pedigreed cousins; their drives and compulsions mercifully muted. The Mutt\xe2\x80\x99s loyalty, warmth, and deep desire to please, however, remain as fiercely intact as any dog you could choose to create.See below for more information on mixed breed dogs!Mutt (Mixed Breed) Dog Pictures Mutt (Mixed) Dog Breed Information, Pictures, Characteristics & Facts - DogTimeInitiate Gallery'

b'The Neapolitan Mastiff dog breed was developed in southern Italy as a family and guard dog. Today this massive breed is known as a gentle giant.Some fans of the breed affectionately call them the Neo, and others know them as Mastino. Although these are purebred dogs, you may still find them in shelters and rescues. Remember to adopt! Don\xe2\x80\x99t shop if this is the breed for you.Neapolitan Mastiffs may not be the best choice for novice dog parents or apartment dwellers. Their massive size means they need space and confident training to thrive. However, if you can handle their needs and a bit of drool, you\xe2\x80\x99ll find an affectionate, loyal companion who loves the whole family!DogTime recommends this big, spacious crate to give your big Neapolitan Mastiff a place to rest and relax.\xc2\xa0You should also pick up this dog brush and massager for your short-haired pup!See all Neapolitan Mastiff dog breed characteristics below!Neapolitan Mastiff Dog Breed Pictures Neapolitan Mastiff Dog Breed Information, Pictures, Characteristics & Facts - DogtimeInitiate Gallery'
height: 24 to 31 inches tall at the shoulder'

about: b'The Newfoundland is a large, strong dog breed from\xe2\x80\x94wait for it\xe2\x80\x94Newfoundland. They were originally used as a working dog to pull nets for fishermen and haul wood from the forest.They\xe2\x80\x99re a capable and hardworking dog, well suited to work on land or water. They\xe2\x80\x99re a strong swimmer and equally strong \xe2\x80\x9cpack horse.\xe2\x80\x9d Sweet-natured and responsive, they make a wonderful family companion as well.DogTime recommends this big, spacious crate to give your big Newfie a place to rest and relax.\xc2\xa0You should also pick up this dog de-shedder for your high shedding pup!See all dog breed traits and facts about Newfoundlands below!Newfoundland Dog Breed Pictures Newfoundland Dog Breed Information, Pictures, Characteristics & Facts - DogtimeInitiate Gallery'
height: 2 feet, 1 inch to 2 feet, 5 inches tall at the shoulder'

about: b'The Norfolk Terrier is what\xe2\x80\x99s considered a \xe2\x80\x9cbig dog in a small package.\xe2\x80\x9d Alert, gregarious, and nimble, they\xe2\x80\x99re a loyal companion with the heart of a working terrier.Although these are purebred dogs, you may still find them in shelters and rescues. Remember to adopt! Don\xe2\x80\x99t shop if this is the breed for you.As a cute and cuddly breed with plenty of love to give, these pups get along with just about everybody in just about any type of living situation. Novice pet parents, apartment dwellers, or lifelong dog lovers in large homes can all fall for this pooch\xe2\x80\x99s charms. But that doesn\xe2\x80\x99t mean you get to relax and snuggle all day. This breed has high energy and needs plenty of exercise to stay happy and healthy. Meet their needs, and you\xe2\x80\x99ll have a tiny best buddy for life.DogTime recommends this carrier for traveling with your small Norfolk Terrier.\xc2\xa0You should also pick up this dog fetch toy to help burn off your pup\xe2\x80\x99s high energy!See below for complete list of Norfolk Terrier dog breed facts and traits!Norfolk Terrier Dog Breed Pictures Norfolk Terrier Dog Breed Information, Pictures, Characteristics & Facts \xe2\x80\x93 DogtimeInitiate Gallery'
height: 9 to 10 inches tall at the shoulder'

about: b'The Northern Inuit Dog is a hybrid breed with a debated background, but most agree that the Husky, Malamute, and German Shepherd Dog are part of their ancestry. Other theories include Samoyeds and Canadian Eskimo Dogs.\xc2\xa0 Though their origin is a mix, they\xe2\x80\x99re now only bred with other Northern Inuit Dogs by breeders seeking\xc2\xa0to secure purebred status for this hybrid. Calm, friendly, and intelligent, these dogs may be a great addition to your family.Despite the nickname and appearance of \xe2\x80\x9cwolfdog,\xe2\x80\x9d there is no actual wolf in their recent ancestry. Though they\xe2\x80\x99ve been popular for decades, especially among people wanting dogs who look like wolves, their popularity spiked with their casting in HBO\xe2\x80\x99s television series\xc2\xa0Game of Thrones as direwolves.Unfortunately, not all who purchase Northern Inuit Dogs end up keeping them, and they end up in shelters and rescues. So please, opt to adopt!While Northern Inuit Dogs may look like wolves, their temperament is much different. They\xe2\x80\x99re often great family dogs and will not show aggression towards their humans. The flip side of their intense loyalty is they may suffer separation anxiety, so they would best fit an environment where someone is home most of the time or with another canine companion. They have a stubborn streak and may be difficult to train, so these dogs would be best for experienced pet parents. Since they are so active, they would also prefer a house with a yard.See below for complete list of hybrid dog breed traits and facts about Northern Inuit Dogs!Northern Inuit Hybrid Dog Breed Pictures Northern Inuit Dog Hybrid Breed Pictures, Characteristics, & FactsInitiate Gallery'

b'Intelligent, independent, and eager to please, the Norwegian Buhund dog breed can handle all kinds of dog jobs and sports with ease. They need lots of exercise and attention, and they\xe2\x80\x99re quick learners.Although these are fairly rare, purebred dogs, you may find them in the care of shelters and rescue groups. Remember to adopt! Don\xe2\x80\x99t shop if you want to bring one of these dogs home.As you might have guessed from their appearance, Norwegian Buhunds handle cold weather with ease. They\xe2\x80\x99re also highly affectionate to the humans in their lives, even with kids. This pup will happily join in for a fun play session in the snow!See below for complete list dog breed traits and facts about Norwegian Buhunds!Norwegian Buhund Dog Breed Pictures Norwegian Buhund Dog Breed Information, Pictures, Characteristics & FactsInitiate Gallery'
height: 16 to 18 inches tall at the shoulder'

about: b'The gorgeous Norwegian Elkhound\xc2\xa0dog breed, with their wolf-like face, delights in life. Smart as can be, they also have a wonderful sense of humor. They\xe2\x80\x99ll race you around the kitchen island, reverse directions when you do, and then howl for sheer fun.Even though these are purebred dogs, some may still end up in the care of shelters or rescues. Consider adoption if this is the breed for you.Bold, energetic, and protective, the Norwegian Elkhound makes an excellent watchdog and guardian. Elkhounds are utterly devoted to their families. When you\xe2\x80\x99re upset, this tenderhearted Viking will plop their head on your lap. Adaptable and affectionate, both experienced pet parents and novices will find it easy to fall in love with these dogs. Just make sure you can provide plenty of exercise to meet their high energy levels. Oh, and prepare to deal with quite a bit of shedding.DogTime recommends this dog bed to give a good night\xe2\x80\x99s sleep to your medium-sized Norwegian Elkhound.\xc2\xa0You should also pick up this dog de-shedder for your high shedding pup!See all dog breed traits and facts about Norwegian Elkhounds below!Norwegian Elkhound Dog Breed Pictures Norwegian Elkhound Dog Breed Information, Pictures, Characteristics & Facts - DogTimeInitiate Gallery'

b'With six toes on each foot \xe2\x80\x94 all of them double- or triple-jointed \xe2\x80\x94 and an amazing range of motion, the agile\xc2\xa0Norwegian Lundehund\xc2\xa0dog breed was used to scale cliffs and rob puffin nests of their eggs.Although these are purebred dogs, you may find them in the care of shelters or rescue groups. Remember to adopt! Don\xe2\x80\x99t shop if you want to bring a dog home!Along with the Norwegian Lundehund\xe2\x80\x99s acrobatic talents, they have a knack for barking and digging, making them a good choice only if you\xe2\x80\x99re prepared to give them lots of supervision and training. They can be very tough to housetrain. Experienced pet parents only!See below for complete list of dog breed traits and facts about Norwegian Lundehunds!Norwegian Lundehund Dog Breed Pictures Norwegian Lundehund Dog Breed Information, Pictures, Characteristics & Facts - DogTimeInitiate Gallery'
height: 1 foot to 1 foot, 3 inches tall at the shoulder'

about: b'The Norwich Terrier originated as a ratter on farms but moved up in the world to bolt foxes from their dens during hunts. Today, they\xe2\x80\x99re amusing companions who serve double duty by keeping your home and yard free of rats and other vermin.Although these are purebred dogs, you may still find them in shelters and rescues. Remember to adopt! Don\xe2\x80\x99t shop if this is the breed for you.These highly affectionate dogs make for great apartment pets, and they\xe2\x80\x99ll get along with everybody, including kids, other dogs, and even strangers who come to your door. Make no mistake, though. These pups have high energy and need to stay physically active, and they won\xe2\x80\x99t appreciate being left home alone for long hours. Give your Norwich plenty of exercise to keep them fit and happy, and you\xe2\x80\x99ll have a loyal, loving best friend for life!DogTime recommends this carrier for traveling with your small Norwich Terrier.\xc2\xa0You should also pick up this interactive puzzle toy to keep your pup active indoors!See below for complete list of Norwich Terrier dog breed facts and traits!Norwich Terrier Dog Breed Pictures Norwich Terrier Dog Breed Information, Pictures, Characteristics & Facts \xe2\x80\x93 DogTimeInitiate Gallery'
height: Up to 10 inches tall at the shoulder'

about: b'The Nova Scotia Duck Tolling Retriever dog breed was created to both lure and retrieve waterfowl. This versatile breed excels in the field and show ring, in obedience and agility, and as a companion to an active family.Highly adaptable and affectionate, these dogs can even fair well in apartments, so long as their humans can keep up with providing enough exercise and lots of daily walks. Without adequate activity, they can end up growing bored and acting out with unwanted behaviors.DogTime recommends this dog bed to give a good night\xe2\x80\x99s sleep to your medium-sized Nova Scotia Duck Tolling Retriever.\xc2\xa0You should also pick up this dog water bottle for any outdoor adventures you have with your pup!See all dog breed traits and facts about Nova Scotia Duck Tolling Retrievers below!Nova Scotia Duck Tolling Retriever Dog Breed Pictures Nova Scotia Duck Trolling Retriever Dog Breed Information, Pictures, Characteristics & Facts - DogtimeInitiate Gallery'
height: 1 foot, 5 inches to 1 foot, 9 inches tall at the shoulder'

about: b'The Old English Sheepdog is a large, athletic dog breed with an unmistakable shaggy coat. The OES, as fans call the breed for short, was historically a drover, helping farmers drive cattle and sheep to the market. Today, this good-natured dog enjoys the comfort of home life and still competes in conformation, obedience, agility, and herding trials.Even though these are purebred dogs, you may find them in the care of shelters or rescue groups. Remember to\xc2\xa0adopt! Don\xe2\x80\x99t shop if you want to bring a dog home.The OES is an adaptable, intelligent dog with an easygoing disposition. They\xe2\x80\x99re affectionate with all members of their families, and despite the fact that they are large dogs, they can fit in well with apartment life so long as they get enough exercise from walks and play sessions. Their shaggy coats also don\xe2\x80\x99t tend to shed as much as you might think. If you\xe2\x80\x99re looking for a loyal, protective, and loving family companion, this may be the breed for you!See below for complete list of dog breed traits and facts about Old English Sheepdogs!Old English Sheepdog Breed Pictures Old English Sheepdog Dog Breed Information, Pictures, Characteristics & Facts \xe2\x80\x93 DogTimeInitiate Gallery'

b'The large and rough-coated Otterhound was originally bred for hunting otter in England. Built for work, the dog breed has a keen nose and renowned stamina.This is an uncommon breed, with fewer than ten litters born each year in the United States and Canada. Still\xc2\xa0some may still end up in the care of shelters or rescues. Consider adoption if this is the breed for you.Otterhounds are also playful clowns, friendly and affectionate with their families. They even love kids and other dogs, and they crave playtime and plenty of exercise to burn off their high energy. In fact, apartment dwellers will find it very difficult to provide enough space for them to run and move. But those who have room to roam and love to give will be rewarded with a loving companion who will never fail to delight their humans with silly antics and fun.DogTime recommends this big, spacious crate to give your big Otterhound a place to rest and relax.\xc2\xa0 You should also pick up this dog water bottle for any outdoor adventures you have with your pup!See below for complete list of Otterhound dog breed facts and characteristics!Otterhound Dog Breed Pictures Otterhound Dog Breed Information, Pictures, Characteristics & Facts - DogTimeInitiate Gallery'

b'The Papillon dog breed descends from the toy spaniels that are frequently portrayed in paintings by the Old Masters, from as far back as the 16th century. They\xe2\x80\x99re highly active and wonderful competitors in agility and obedience.Even though these are purebred dogs, you may find them in the care of shelters or rescue groups. Remember to\xc2\xa0adopt! Don\xe2\x80\x99t shop if you want to bring a dog home.The breed\xe2\x80\x99s sparkling personality makes these dogs a favorite of all who meet them. Even though you might think of Papillons as lap dogs, these pooch\xe2\x80\x99s are active and playful, and they won\xe2\x80\x99t be content lounging on the couch with you all day. They do, however, love companionship and will always try to be where their humans are. This is not the breed for you if you\xe2\x80\x99re away from home for long hours of the day. Meet the breed\xe2\x80\x99s needs, and you\xe2\x80\x99ll have a loving companion who won\xe2\x80\x99t want to leave your side!See below for complete list of dog breed traits and facts about Papillons!Papillon Dog Breed Pictures Papillon Dog Breed Information, Pictures, Characteristics & Facts \xe2\x80\x93 DogTimeInitiate Gallery'
height: 8 to 11 inches tall at the shoulder'

about: b'The Papipoo is a mixed breed dog \xe2\x80\x94 a cross between the Papillon and Poodle dog breeds. Loving, intelligent, and active, this devoted, little dog wants to be part of all family activities.Papipoos are also known as Papoodles,\xc2\xa0Papi Doodles, Papidoodles, and Papi Poos.\xc2\xa0They\xe2\x80\x99re considered \xe2\x80\x9cdesigner dogs,\xe2\x80\x9d making them in high demand, which also means they\xe2\x80\x99re readily found in shelters or rescues. Please adopt if you\xe2\x80\x99d like to add one of these pups to your life. Remember, when you adopt, you save two lives\xe2\x80\x93the one you bring home and the one you make room for at the shelter.As a cross between old-world breeds known for their intelligence and athleticism, the Papipoo has it all, with brains and brawn, not to mention beauty. Although these dogs are active, their size lends well to any dwelling, including small apartments. Their sociability makes them a good fit for all types of families, provided they get attention throughout the day. If you want an affectionate, little lapdog who may also be a contender for the Canine Olympics, this may be a perfect dog for you!See below for all Papipoo facts and mixed dog breed traits!Papipoo Mixed Dog Breed Pictures Papipoo Mixed Dog Breed Pictures, Characteristics, & FactsInitiate Gallery'

b'A Peekapoo is hybrid dog breed \xe2\x80\x94 a cross between the\xc2\xa0Pekingese and Poodle breeds. The mix makes for a wonderful companion dog who will spend their days perched on your lap or sitting by your side.Although these dogs got their start as a designer breed, you may still find them in the care of shelters and rescue groups. Adopt! Don\xe2\x80\x99t shop if you want to bring a dog home!These dogs are loyal and affectionate and can be quite protective of the people they love \xe2\x80\x94 which tends to be hilarious in such a small dog. Affectionate and playful, these pups get along with all members of the family. They can even make great companions for novice pet parents. Whether you live in an apartment or a large house with a yard, Peekapoos will make themselves at home. They\xe2\x80\x99ll be happy as long as they can stay by your side. Just don\xe2\x80\x99t leave them home alone for too long during the day, or you may see signs of separation anxiety.See below for complete list hybrid dog breed traits and facts about Peekapoos!Peekapoo Hybrid Dog Breed Pictures Peekapoo Hybrid Dog Breed Information, Pictures, Characteristics & Facts \xe2\x80\x93 DogTimeInitiate Gallery'
height: Up to 11 inches tall at the shoulder'

about: b'Pekingese dogs were bred for centuries to be the cherished companions of the imperial family of China. Today they\xe2\x80\x99re still cherished family companions and show dogs who greet everyone they meet with dignity and grace.Even though these are purebred dogs, you may find them in the care of shelters or rescue groups. Remember to\xc2\xa0adopt! Don\xe2\x80\x99t shop if you want to bring a dog home.The Peke is an adaptable dog who can live with just about anybody, including apartment dwellers and novice pet parents. However, they have a tendency to bark, which neighbors might not be too thrilled about. They also tend to stick to one human caretaker most of all. Children may injure them during rough play, so they\xe2\x80\x99re best suited to homes with teens and adults. If you can meet the breed\xe2\x80\x99s needs, you\xe2\x80\x99ll have a loving, loyal companion who won\xe2\x80\x99t want to leave your side!See below for complete list of dog breed traits and facts about Pekingese!Pekingese Dog Breed Pictures Pekingese Dog Breed Information, Pictures, Characteristics & Facts \xe2\x80\x93 DogTimeInitiate Gallery'
height: 6 to 9 inches tall at the shoulder'

about: b'Originally bred to herd cattle, sheep, and horses, the Pembroke Welsh Corgi is an active and intelligent dog breed. Easy to train and eager to learn, Pembrokes are great with children and other pets, and you can find them in four different coat colors and markings.Even though these are purebred dogs, you may find them in the care of shelters or rescue groups. Remember to\xc2\xa0adopt! Don\xe2\x80\x99t shop if you want to bring a dog home.Adaptable and loving with the whole family, Corgis can fit into just about any household, whether it\xe2\x80\x99s an apartment or large home with a yard. However, they do have quite a bit of energy for a small dog. They\xe2\x80\x99ll need plenty of walks and active play sessions. You might be surprised by how quickly these short-legged pups can move! For humans who can meet the breed\xe2\x80\x99s needs, the Pembroke will make an excellent family companion, even for novice pet parents.See below for complete list of dog breed traits and facts about Pembroke Welsh Corgis!Pembroke Welsh Corgi Dog Breed Pictures Pembroke Welsh Corgi Dog Breed Information, Pictures, Characteristics & Facts - DogtimeInitiate Gallery Stuff For Corgi Fans'
height: 10 to 12 inches tall at the shoulder'

about: b'The Petit Basset Griffon Vend\xc3\xa9en is a small scent hound who has won the hearts of millions. Although the dog breed appears to be designed for winsome cuteness, in actuality, PBGVs are tough hunters who were developed for a specific purpose: to hunt small game in the rough terrain of the Vendeen region of France. The breed is known for a merry and outgoing personality.Even though these are purebred dogs, some may still end up in the care of shelters or rescues. Consider adoption if this is the breed for you.Adaptable and affectionate, these pups can fair well in apartment living situations. They do have high energy levels, though, and because of that, they need plenty of exercise. PBGVs can also have a stubborn streak, so they\xe2\x80\x99ll need plenty of consistent training with lots of positive reinforcement. If you can provide this pooch with lots of physical activity and care, you\xe2\x80\x99ll be rewarded with a loving companion for the whole family, even for other resident canines.DogTime recommends this dog bed to give a good night\xe2\x80\x99s sleep to your medium-sized Petit Basset Griffon Vend\xc3\xa9en.\xc2\xa0You should also pick up this interactive puzzle toy to keep your pup active indoors!See below for complete list of Petit Basset Griffon Vend\xc3\xa9en characteristics!Petit Basset Griffon Vend\xc3\xa9en Dog Breed Pictures Petit Basset Griffon Vendeen Dog Breed Information, Pictures, Characteristics & Facts - DogtimeInitiate Gallery'
height: 13 to 15 inches tall at the shoulder'

about: b'The Pharaoh Hound is an ancient dog breed that\xe2\x80\x99s changed little since their development more than 5,000 years ago. They were the dogs of kings and may have hunted gazelles with pharaohs, hence their name. This loyal hunting companion later made their way to Malta, where they\xe2\x80\x99re now the national dog.Even though these are purebred dogs, some may still end up in the care of shelters or rescues. Consider adoption if this is the breed for you.You need not be royalty to befriend the Pharaoh Hound. Adaptable and affectionate, these pups make great family companions, even for novice pet parents and apartment dwellers. Pharaoh Hounds delight their humans with clownish antics and will love to make you laugh. They also have a sensitive side, though, and are even known to blush! Return this pup\xe2\x80\x99s love in kind, and you\xe2\x80\x99ll have a loyal friend for life.DogTime recommends this dog bed to give a good night\xe2\x80\x99s sleep to your medium-sized Pharaoh Hound. You should also pick up this interactive puzzle toy to keep your pup active indoors!See below for complete list of dog breed traits and facts about Pharaoh Hounds!Pharaoh Hound Dog Breed Pictures Pharaoh Hound Dog Breed Information, Pictures, Characteristics, & Facts - DogTimeInitiate Gallery'
height: 21 to 25 inches tall at the shoulder'

about: b'The Pitsky is a mixed breed dog \xe2\x80\x94 a cross between the American Pit Bull Terrier and Siberian Husky dog breeds. They range in size from medium to large, they are energetic, and loyal, these pups inherited some of the best qualities from both of their parents.Pitskies don\xe2\x80\x99t go by any other names \xe2\x80\x94 maybe because Hutbull doesn\xe2\x80\x99t have the same ring \xe2\x80\x94 just Pitsky or Husky/Pit mix or Pit/Husky mix. Despite their unfortunate status as a designer breed, you may find these mixed breed dogs in shelters and rescues. So remember to adopt! Don\xe2\x80\x99t shop!These high energy dogs need fast-paced lifestyles. Novice dog parents are not recommended. Pitskies are demanding and high maintenance. If you love Siberian Huskies and American Pit Bull Terriers and have experience with both, then this mixed breed may be a perfect choice for you!See below for all mixed dog breed traits and facts about Pitskies!Pitsky Mixed Dog Breed Pictures Pitsky Mixed Dog Breed Pictures, Characteristics, & FactsInitiate Gallery'

b'The pack-hunting Plott\xc2\xa0dog breed was developed in North Carolina more than 200 years ago to hunt bear and wild boar. They are still used as hunting dogs today and have proven their worth as pack hunters. They also participate in tracking and other dog sports.Even though these are purebred dogs, some may still end up in the care of shelters or rescues. Consider adoption if this is the breed for you.Plotts are best suited to life in the country where they have plenty of room to roam. They need lots of exercise and, due to their pack hunting heritage, would likely prefer a home with at least one other resident canine. Socialization is a must with this breed. Make sure you have a high fence, wherever you live, if you bring one of these pups home, though. They love to chase and wander. Give your dog plenty of physical activity and consistent training, and you\xe2\x80\x99ll be rewarded with a loyal companion for life.DogTime recommends this dog bed to give a good night\xe2\x80\x99s sleep to your medium-sized Plott.\xc2\xa0You should also pick up this dog brush and massager for your short-haired pup!See below for complete list of Plott dog breed facts and characteristics!Plott Dog Breed Pictures Plott Dog Breed Information, Pictures, Characteristics & Facts - DogTimeInitiate Gallery'
height: 20 to 27 inches tall at the shoulder'

about: b'Smaller than the average Beagle dog breed, these compact scenthounds are merry and fun-loving. But the Pocket Beagle is still a hound and, as such, requires patience and creative training techniques to overcome their sometimes stubborn nature.Even though these are purebred dogs, you may find them in the care of shelters or rescue groups. Remember to\xc2\xa0adopt! Don\xe2\x80\x99t shop if you want to bring a dog home.Pocket Beagles are super affectionate with their families, including other dogs and kids. They\xe2\x80\x99re energetic and playful, too, so they make for excellent playmates. Just make sure children know how to properly and safely interact with a small dog, and supervise play sessions, as even well trained Beagles can get a little rambunctious. Apartment dwellers can also enjoy this breed, provided they can give their dogs plenty of exercise and walks. These pups get along with just about everybody! Just don\xe2\x80\x99t leave them home alone for too long, or they may act out in unwanted ways.See below for complete Pocket Beagle characteristics!Pocket Beagle Dog Breed Pictures Pocket Beagle Dog Breed Information, Pictures, Characteristics & Facts \xe2\x80\x93 DogTimeInitiate Gallery'
height: 7 to 12 inches tall at the shoulder'

about: b'Bred for several hundred years to \xe2\x80\x9cpoint\xe2\x80\x9d birds and small game such as rabbits, the Pointer is a versatile field dog and exceptional family dog breed. They excel in many arenas, from the field to the show ring, agility to obedience.Energetic and fun-loving, they\xe2\x80\x99re well suited to active homes where they\xe2\x80\x99ll can be loving members of the family. Apartment dwellers beware, though. These dogs need plenty of space to play and lots of daily exercise to keep their high energy in check. Otherwise, they may find their own fun by acting out with unwanted behaviors.DogTime recommends this dog bed to give a good night\xe2\x80\x99s sleep to your medium-sized Pointer.\xc2\xa0You should also pick up this dog brush and massager for your short-haired pup!See all dog breed traits and facts about Pointers below!Pointer Dog Breed Pictures Pointer Dog Breed Information, Pictures, Characteristics & Facts - DogtimeInitiate Gallery'
height: 1 foot, 11 inches to 2 feet, 4 inches tall at the shoulder'

about: b'Originally bred for herding and guarding, the Polish Lowland Sheepdog is still an excellent working dog breed. They\xe2\x80\x99re obedient and fearless, good-natured with people and other dogs, but highly protective of their flock.Even though these are purebred dogs, you may find them in the care of shelters or rescue groups. Remember to\xc2\xa0adopt! Don\xe2\x80\x99t shop if you want to bring a dog home.Polish Lowland Sheedogs are intelligent, active, strong, and handsome with their characteristic multicolored, shaggy coat. In recent years, they\xe2\x80\x99ve gained popularity as a companion dog. They\xe2\x80\x99re highly affectionate with their human families and can even adapt to apartment life. Novice pet parents should beware, though, as these pups need plenty of exercise, and their coats need frequent grooming sessions to stay tangle free. If you can provide lots of physical activity and don\xe2\x80\x99t mind a bit of extra brushing, this may be the breed for you!See below for a complete list of dog breed traits and facts about Polish Lowland Sheepdogs!Polish Lowland Sheepdog Breed Pictures Polish Lowland Sheepdog Dog Breed Information, Pictures, Characteristics & Facts \xe2\x80\x93 DogtimeInitiate Gallery'
height: 17 to 20 inches tall at the shoulder'

about: b'The Pomapoo is a mixed breed dog \xe2\x80\x94 a cross between the Pomeranian and Toy\xc2\xa0Poodle dog breeds. Compact, intelligent, and affectionate, these pups inherited some of the best qualities from both of their parents.Pomapoos are also called Pooranian, Pompoo, and Pomeroodle. Despite their unfortunate status as a designer breed, you may find these mixed breed dogs in shelters and rescues, so remember to adopt! Don\xe2\x80\x99t shop!These adorable pups make great apartment dogs, and they also work well in large households. Socialize them early to bring out their best qualities and ensure a friendly, confident pup. Read on, to find out if this mixed breed is the right dog for you.See below for all Pomapoo facts and mixed dog breed characteristics!Pomapoo Mixed Dog Breed Pictures Pomapoo Mixed Dog Breed Pictures, Characteristics, & FactsInitiate Gallery'

b'The Pomchi is a mixed-breed dog \xe2\x80\x94 a cross between the Pomeranian and the Chihuahua dog breeds. Playful, devoted, and energetic, these small pups inherited some of the best qualities from both of their parents.Pomchis go by several names, including Pomahuahua, Chimeranian, Chi-Pom, and Pom-Chi. Despite their unfortunate status as a designer breed, you may find these mixed breed dogs in shelters and rescues. So remember to adopt! Don\xe2\x80\x99t shop!These adorable pups make excellent apartment dogs for active urban dwellers, and they also do well in small and single-person households. If you\xe2\x80\x99re looking for a small, attention-loving dog with a lot of spunk, then the Pomchi may be the right dog for you!See below for all mixed dog breed traits and facts about Pomchis!Pomchi Mixed Dog Breed Pictures Pomchi Mixed Dog Breed Pictures, Characteristics, & FactsInitiate Gallery'

b'The Pomeagle is a mixed breed dog \xe2\x80\x94 a cross between the Pomeranian and Beagle dog breeds. Small, affectionate, and curious by nature, these pups inherited some of the best qualities from both of their parents.Pomeagles also go by the names Beagle Pom or Pomeranian Beagle mix. Despite their unfortunate status as a designer breed, you may find these mixed breed dogs in shelters and rescues, so remember to adopt! Don\xe2\x80\x99t shop!These adorable pups do well in apartments and houses with fenced yards. Just make sure the yard is secure, as they have a tendency to track and follow scents. Their wanderlust could lead them into dangerous situations, like traffic. So be careful and take extra precautions.They also do well in large families with older children. Pomeagles love endless play sessions and activity. They should not be left alone for long periods. Multiple pet families would be ideal. Isolation is their biggest enemy.See below for all Pomeagle facts and mixed dog breed characteristics!Pomeagle Mixed Dog Breed Pictures Pomeagle Mixed Dog Breed Pictures, Characteristics, & FactsInitiate Gallery Special thanks to @jager_beggar,\xc2\xa0@lu.nnah,\xc2\xa0@cheyennegriffith1994, and @pawsandwander on Instagram for supplying images.'

b'Descended from large sled dog breeds, the now-tiny Pomeranian has a long and interesting history. The foxy-faced dog, nicknamed \xe2\x80\x9cthe little dog who thinks he can,\xe2\x80\x9d is compact, active, and capable of competing in agility and obedience or simply being a family friend.Even though these are purebred dogs, you may find them in the care of shelters or rescue groups. Remember to\xc2\xa0adopt! Don\xe2\x80\x99t shop if you want to bring a dog home.Poms may be small, but they don\xe2\x80\x99t always act that way and may even challenge larger dogs. While they make for good apartment pets, they can also bark a lot, which your neighbors may not be too thrilled about. But as long as you give your dog plenty of exercise and playtime, keep them out of hot weather, and give them lots of love and attention, you\xe2\x80\x99ll have a loving, adorable, furry family companion!See below for complete list of dog breed traits and facts about Pomeranians!Pomeranian Dog Breed Pictures Pomeranian Dog Breed Information, Pictures, Characteristics & Facts \xe2\x80\x93 DogTimeInitiate Gallery'
height: 7 to 12 inches tall at the shoulder'

about: b'Cute, silly, and suited for apartment life, the Pomsky is a dog who likes to be the center of attention, and with their adorable looks and playful antics, they often get the adoration they crave.Their unfortunate start as a designer breed mixed between Siberian Husky and Pomeranian parents hasn\xe2\x80\x99t stopped them from earning popularity with dog lovers. Unfortunately, those who rush to buy Pomsky puppies from breeders often find themselves overwhelmed and unprepared for their needs.Because of that, these mixed breed dogs sometimes end up in the care of shelters or rescues. You should always consider adoption first. Plenty of groups can help you find Pomskies looking for forever homes if this is the mixed breed for you.See below for complete list mixed dog breed traits and facts about Pomskies!Pomsky Dog Breed Pictures Pomsky Dog Breed Information & Pictures \xe2\x80\x93 DogtimeInitiate Gallery'

b'The Poochon is a mixed breed dog\xe2\x80\x93a cross between the Toy Poodle and Bichon Frise dog breeds. Small, happy, and intelligent, these pups inherited some of the best qualities from both of their parents. Researching their parents can offer much insight into their personalities and characteristics.Poochons are also called Bichpoo, Bichon Poo, and Bichon Poodle . Despite their unfortunate status as a designer breed, you can find these mixed-breed dogs in shelters and breed specific rescues, so remember to adopt! Don\xe2\x80\x99t shop!These adorable pups would be a great addition to a big family or single person household. They would also do well in an apartment. Just make sure to start training early to curb excessive barking. If you want a playful, cuddly, low-shed pup, who will love you unconditionally, the Poochon may be the right dog for you!See below for all mixed dog breed traits and facts about Poochons!Poochon Mixed Dog Breed Pictures Poochon Mixed Dog Breed Pictures, Characteristics, & FactsInitiate Gallery'

b'Elegant. Proud. Clever. The Poodle is an impressive dog, as the many best-in-show winners from this dog breed can attest. But behind the blue ribbons, impressive hairdos, and regal attitude, you\xe2\x80\x99ll find an affectionate family dog with an ancient history and many talents.Even though these are purebred dogs, you may find them in the care of shelters or rescue groups. Remember to\xc2\xa0adopt! Don\xe2\x80\x99t shop if you want to bring a dog home.Poodles are regarded as one of the most intelligent breeds in the world. They\xe2\x80\x99re highly trainable and well suited for just about any task you put them to \xe2\x80\x94 and you will want to give them tasks to do. Bored Poodles can get destructive if they aren\xe2\x80\x99t physically and mentally stimulated. But active owners who can meet their dog\xe2\x80\x99s needs will find a loving, smart, trainable, and loyal family companion.See below for complete list of dog breed traits and facts about Poodles!Poodle Dog Breed Pictures Poodle Dog Breed Information, Pictures, Characteristics & Facts \xe2\x80\x93 DogTimeInitiate Gallery'
height: From 10 to over 22 inches tall at the shoulder'

about: b'The Portuguese Podengo Pequeno is a purebred dog from Portugal and is the smallest of the three Portuguese Podengo size classes that are not interbred. Alert, lively, and playful, these pooches are a compact-but-charming bunch to be around.Portuguese Podengo Pequenos go by several other names, such as Podengo Portuguese, Portuguese Warren Hound, and the Portuguese Rabbit Dog. If you want to bring one of these small, purebred dogs home, you can check your local shelters or rescues near you. Remember to adopt and not shop!These small pups make great apartment dogs for city dwellers due to their size and temperament. They are well-suited for households of all types, including singles and families with children of all ages. They are quite lively and will bark once and a while. If you want a playful and active pup who will keep you on your toes, alert you to any potential dangers, and love you unconditionally, this may be the right breed for you!See below for all dog breed traits and facts about Portuguese Podengo Pequenos!Portuguese Podengo Pequeno Dog Breed Pictures Portuguese Podengo Pequeno Dog Breed Pictures, Characteristics, & FactsInitiate Gallery'

b'In Portugal, people call the Portuguese Sheepdog \xe2\x80\x9cc\xc3\xa3o da Serra de Aires,\xe2\x80\x9d which is the name of a mountain range in the breed\xe2\x80\x99s native land.\xc2\xa0 They\xe2\x80\x99re also nicknamed \xe2\x80\x9cc\xc3\xa3o macaco,\xe2\x80\x9d which translates to \xe2\x80\x9cmonkey dog,\xe2\x80\x9d due to the breed\xe2\x80\x99s habit for making quizzical expressions that remind people of monkeys.The Portuguese Sheepdog is a herding breed who is totally devoted to their flock, though today they usually act more as a watchdog and companion dog. They\xe2\x80\x99re usually found in their native lands of Portugal. They\xe2\x80\x99re also very rare with only a small number in existence today.Although these are rare, purebred dogs, you may still find them in shelters and rescues. Remember to adopt! Don\xe2\x80\x99t shop if this is the breed for you.This dog would make an excellent addition to a family or person who has dog experience. A home with a secure yard is a must for this intelligent and lively breed. They thrive on family activities and are very loyal, forming strong bonds with their families.See below for complete list of dog breed traits and facts about Portuguese Sheepdogs!Portuguese Sheepdog Breed Pictures Portuguese Sheepdog Breed Pictures, Characteristics, & FactsInitiate Gallery'
